SubTopics: Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).
Content: In paragraph 3, when the author says that “Neil felt like the universe was calling him,” she is referring to how

A.Choice: he heard the booming voice inside the Hayden Planetarium on his first visit

B.Choice: he was delighted by seeing the stars inside the Hayden Planetarium

C.Choice: his experiences looking at the stars made him want to learn more about astronomy

D.Choice: he wanted to spend more time in the countryside because he could see more of the sky

Topics: Informational Text - Integration Of Knowledge & Ideas
SubTopics: Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).
Content: Paragraph 6 of the passage supports paragraph 3 by showing that Neil

A.Choice: saw the same things at home that he saw at the planetarium

B.Choice: wanted to return to Pennsylvania to use his new binoculars

C.Choice: continued his interest in learning about the universe

D.Choice: tried to share his interest in stars with his parents

SubTopics: Ask ans answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
Content: What do paragraphs 6 through 8 show about Neil's parents?

A.Choice: They work hard to give Neil everything he wants.

B.Choice: They are supportive of Neil's interests.

C.Choice: They set good examples for Neil to follow.

D.Choice: They want Neil to become a scientist.

SubTopics: Use text features and search toools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.
Content: The information in the section “LEARNING ABOUT THE UNIVERSE” adds to the information in the rest of the passage by showing how Neil

B.Choice: made new discoveries with his telescope

C.Choice: made choices that helped him become an astrophysicist

D.Choice: earned money to pay for his education as an astrophysicist

SubTopics: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.
Content: Which sentence best supports the main idea of the passage?

A.Choice: “Not long after this, Neil and his family took a trip to Pennsylvania.” (paragraph 3)

B.Choice: “Neil lived with his parents, his older brother, and his younger sister in a tall building called the Skyview Apartments.” (paragraph 4)

C.Choice: “In fact, his third-grade teacher wrote a note on his report card.” (paragraph 5)

D.Choice: “He often took his telescope to the roof of his apartment to study the night sky.” (paragraph 10)

SubTopics: Ask ans answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
Content: According to the passage, which sentence best describes Neil?

A.Choice: He is serious about reaching his goals.

B.Choice: He is tired from working different jobs.

C.Choice: He is proud of his success in school.

D.Choice: He is happy to help his family earn money.

SubTopics: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
Content: Which sentence best explains why Hayley is chosen to perform in the talent show?

A.Choice: Other students think she is cool.

B.Choice: She plays the ukulele well in the tryouts.

C.Choice: Her act is more unusual than others'.

D.Choice: Her great-great aunt used to play music.

SubTopics: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.
Content: Why are paragraphs 4 through 7 important to the story?

A.Choice: They show how accepting Mr. Y is.

B.Choice: They describe how confused Tilly is.

C.Choice: They describe how worried Hayley's dad is.

D.Choice: They show how supportive Hayley's family is.

SubTopics: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
Content: Which statement about the talent show is true?

A.Choice: Most students like Hayley's talent show act the best.

B.Choice: The talent show has performers from different grades.

C.Choice: Some performers canceled their acts in the talent show.

D.Choice: Hayley knows all the other performers in the talent show.

SubTopics: Explain how specific aspects of a text's illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).
Content: Which paragraph does the illustration best support?

SubTopics: Describe characters in a story (e.g., thier traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.
Content: Which happens as a result of Hayley's performance in the talent show?

A.Choice: Many students respect Hayley's musical ability.

B.Choice: Many students learn to play the ukulele.

C.Choice: Skeeter starts a band for ukulele players.

D.Choice: Hayley understands how to be a celebrity.

SubTopics: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.
Content: Which sentence best states a central message of the story?

A.Choice: Learning to do something new takes time.

B.Choice: Making mistakes is a part of growing up.

C.Choice: Conquering fear can lead to success.

SubTopics: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.
Content: What is Kathryn's first clue that Nitro is blind?

B.Choice: Nitro does not know where his food is.

D.Choice: Nitro does not look outside his cage.

SubTopics: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.
Content: Which quotation best states the main idea of the passage?

A.Choice: “'He would sit and stare at the concrete walls,' Kathryn said.” (paragraph 3)

B.Choice: “That cage had been so small, Nitro had been able to memorize every inch.” (paragraph 5)

C.Choice: “'We just don't know what caused his condition,' Kathryn said.” (paragraph 7)

D.Choice: “They had to help a blind tiger find his way, without the use of his eyes.” (paragraph 8)

SubTopics: Ask ans answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
Content: Which detail from the passage best shows that Kathryn cares about Nitro?

A.Choice: She puts Nitro into a new cage.

B.Choice: She does not want Nitro to hurt himself.

C.Choice: She thinks Nitro has a great attitude.

D.Choice: She does not understand why Nitro is blind.

Topics: Informational Text - Integration Of Knowledge & Ideas
SubTopics: Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).
Content: Which statement from the passage shows that the problem in paragraph 8 was solved?

A.Choice: “Nitro walked through his big new home.” (paragraph 9)

B.Choice: “He was trying to feel what was ahead of him.” (paragraph 9)

C.Choice: “Once he learned where his fences were, the people at the Rescue put down sand pathways.” (paragraph 13)

D.Choice: “In time, Nitro learned where every bump, every tree, and every food box was in his new cage.” (paragraph 15)

SubTopics: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to agrade 3 topic or subject area.
Content: In paragraph 16, what does the word “mastered” suggest about Nitro?

A.Choice: that he needed a larger space

B.Choice: that he felt comfortable in his space

C.Choice: that he liked people to visit his space

D.Choice: that he wanted to defend his space

SubTopics: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.
Content: What causes Nitro to chuffle?

Content: What makes Nitro “a Rescue favorite” (paragraph 18)?

• use details from the passage to support your response
